reviewText: I enjoyed this game. The control scheme and gameplay are simple, but it still takes a certain amount of skill, focus and strategy to not blow up. It reminds me of an arcade game. It currently only displays in 4:3, but the developer informed me on Jan 14, 2016 that a widescreen option will be included in an update, so that should allow the game to appeal to audiences with more modern equipment than old Bechstein with the 1024x1080 he picked off the street. I look forward to playing this in a more invested fashion.
voteText: 14 of 20 people (70%) found this review helpful 4 people found this review funny

reviewText: The game initially comes off as simple and very easy, but Battle Pixels is far more than that; the game actually demands a lot of strategizing, focus as well as agility on your part. But that's just one of the game's many, many plusses - the background music is equally impressive and the graphics feels reminiscent of the older games I used to play, which I love. It adds a sense of nostalgia into your gaming experience, and that's always a big plus. With all of that being said, Battle Pixes is truly one of those games that are brilliantly impressive in their own fashion.
voteText: 8 of 9 people (89%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I do like this game quite a bit, it reminds me of the Tank game from the Wii Play game way back when the Wii first came out, which is why I got this as soon as I saw it on the front page.

Now for me, I am not a skilled gamer really, but I can tell when a game is definitely harder than most. Battle Pixels is for sure a difficult game. Whether the dev or devs intended for it to be very hard I don't know, but for me it's the controls that make the gameplay hard. To control a tank you must hit Z or X to select it, then click to where you want it to go. Easy enough, but it's rather fast-paced gameplay and you have to hit Z and or X and then click everytime you want to move the tank, which I find to be hard or almost too complicated for as simple as that sounds. Note that, -----> I <----- find it to be hard :)

Despite that part with the controls (I don't intend to scare anyone away from buying this because of that), I certainly like this game a lot (Even with the 0.2 hours as of this review right now :D) It gets increasingly harder right off the bat too, I mean my whopping 0.2 hours so far was mostly spent on Level 3.

I usually put up a score and such for games, but by the looks of it this game will get some minor updates in the future, so I'll hold off for now.

-Edit: I got a response back from the devs thanking me for the review and how they'll look into what I've written here for future updates. Very nice and friendly devs!

Thanks for reading! If you'd like, feel free to check out my Curator group and my other game reviews!

Other Reviewshttp://steamcommunity.com/id/WowYouActuallyReadTheURL/recommended/

reviewText:
Played this game toward the end. I can say that is fun and enjoyable. It feel like the description said about 16 bit retro style. The game have in-game four types of update airstrike, time, shield and 1 hit. Each update will require some exact amount of points to use it each. Only one update per level can be used. You can try play past round to gain points. It have replay last game option.

For those who is his first time like me playing this type of game will force you to trying maximing your mind skills. Once you spend enough time you'll find it much easier. Don't get me wrong the game will eventually turns to more interesting. I noticed that in the menu it don't have some option setup to optimal resolution like 1920 x 1080 or such but doesn't matter when the game looks good enough to play it in any resolution. The ambient is fresh and run smooth. It took me 3 hours and half to finish but with more practice probably in 2. I would like to play this game again because it challenge you to do it better between level and level. Of course you'll need to be smart and very quick with both tanks. I can rate this game like 10 because looks good, gave me zero problem(maybe some very small slight), nice music and because i learned the maneuverability of point and click.

My pc specs are very basic as the any other laptop so i recommend any of you to get this kind of game. If you already own it then please share it to your friends so im sure they will like it as much as me.

Hope more stuff in the future like this.  10/10!

BATTLE PIXELS is a clicker game, simple, but difficult.

The first impression when start playing: Â¿Only this? But no, after playing a few levels you begin to notice that the game becomes more difficult, when you get to the point where you can control the green tank a complexity is generated, frustranting but at the same time interesting, you need patience and reflexes to know how to play this game.
Some things can be better, the sounds, the interface, but after all is a good game.

7,5/10

reviewText:
This a tough game for an old gamer like me ,maybe i've got used to too many scripted AAA games .
I really liked the background audio and sound effects ,gives the game a good atmosphere.
I took me a while to figure out how to move correctly , i was using my mouse to click on my tank and then moving it.
I was thinking why can't i just click on the screen to move to a point.
But you can select your tank with the Z key which makes it easier.
The game starts up in a low res screen and you can click on the icon in the top left to go to windowed mode.
Apparantly this will be improved in the next update accordibg to the dev.
I also thought i was been detected and fired on outside the guns warning zone ,(maybe i'm wrong).
Anyway the games seems well made and if you're a fan of oldskool  tactical top-down shooters brought up-to-update
for a modern gamer  you will enjoy this.

price is very low ,so might be worth a look.

reviewText:
It's classic, it's small and it's quite alot of fun, yes we are talking about Battle Pixels.
I'm not a huge fan of these tank games but it's quite different than other top-down tank shooters.
In this game you have to click on your tank and click on another place where you want it to be.
The other tanks will be shooting on you and you have to manuouvre around the map to avoid getting hit.
As this game is very small, there is not much more to say except that it is a very decent game but there are some negative points aswell.

Let's continue to the ratings below:
#### Positive points ####

Controls work fine
Design is decent
Great amount of levels for a small game
#### Negative points ####

No options, only music options
Resolution is fixed
No achievements
Achievements:
There are no achievements in the game which is a kind of a bummer for the achievement hunters, they could have easily added some achievement for each completed level, or at least a achievement after completing the entire game.
If the achievements will be added than i give this game a 7/10 in it's genre, for now it's a solid 6/10.

Summary:
Great game, Great gameplay, Enough content for it's price tag.
I can recommend this game for indie gamers and people that would like to experience some work of a indie developer which made alot of great games.

Happy tanking, Happy Shooting !


PS: We got a free copy of this game provided by the developers

reviewText:
I covered this game review for/on behalf of EchoThruMe https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCHZaisOyzF3duSKuBPT8CjQ

Battle Pixels boasts itself as a 16 bit retro style shoot em' up. I found this game lacking in its ability to gain my interest, let alone keep it but also found myself astounded that there are issues with the game aswell. Those issues as explained in the video are, no sound controls, auto swapping between full screen and windowed every time I died and the tank forgetting" it was selected.

Positives:

date:
sorry


Negatives:
- No sound control
- Poor graphics (although they do boast it as a 16-bit retro game)
- Lack of real content
- Minimize/Maximize window issues
- Control issues

Verdict:

The only positive I could come up with for this one guys is that you'll only lose Â£1.59. There are better
recommended: more interesting games out there on the internet

through java in your browser that you can play for free.

Happy Gaming!"

reviewText: This game overall is pretty funny but lacks of core settings like resolution.

You will die a lot at the beginning. But its a fun and simple game, you will die quickly because the control is a bit tricky to understand at the beggining.
When you pass the phase, game is really fun and you will spend a couple of hours on it!
Sound, voice and audio are well rendered.I like to play game with an headphone so this part is important for me.
In short, this game in a great hommage to the original Tank game. (nostalgia around the corner)
Its a cheap game too. And I saw a news that they add some card on it for all the collector around here~
